content: This article includes a list of general references, but **it lacks sufficient corresponding inline citations**. Please help to improve this article by introducing more precise citations. *(May 2020)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)*Radio station **Love 972** ([Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 最愛頻道) is a [Mandarin Chinese](/wiki/Mandarin_Chinese) [radio station](/wiki/Radio_station) in Singapore. Owned by the state-owned broadcaster [Mediacorp](/wiki/Mediacorp), it primarily broadcasts an [adult contemporary](/wiki/Adult_contemporary_music) format focusing on [Chinese](/wiki/Mandopop) pop music. ## History The station was originally set to launch in October 1994. It was described as a Chinese equivalent to the English-language [Class 95](/wiki/Class_95_(radio_station)), and planned to target the increasing number of bilingual listeners, specifically workers between age 30 and 40 from the middle to higher income bracket. Test transmissions began in June 1994. The station launched on 23 September 1994. Its Chinese name translates as "Best Loved Station". The station initially had five deejays coming from SBC and [Rediffusion](/wiki/Rediffusion_Singapore). - [List of radio stations in Singapore](/wiki/List_of_radio_stations_in_Singapore) - Official Website - Live Radio Stream This article about a radio station in Asia is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e This article about media in Singapore is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Love 972
